Reviews.Title: “Very solid average”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneRunner
Reviews.Content: Set your expectations if you're planning to stay here. Its a decently located, clean, affordable hotel. Thats all. If you are on a budget then $129CAN for a double room isnt too bad and this rate includes breakfast. There is some parking out the back. The rooms are huge and our bathroom was recently renovated to a clean modern style. The bed was hard which suited me but pained my boyfriend. Breakfast is served until 12.30 and includes juice, coffee, bagels, pastries and yoghurt. Everything about this place is quite tired. The dining and common room remind me of most decent backpacking hostels I've stayed in - functional but not inviting. If you are looking for cheap and cheerful this place will do.

Reviews.Title: “Small, with a European Taste”
Reviews.Author: LeontheHut
Reviews.Content: My sister, her boyfriend, and my girlfriend and I stayed here in August 2011. It is easy to miss from the outside. However once inside, it was really nice. The rooms were very cost efficient, as Montreal can get hella expensive. Even though it was on the cheaper side, you don't sacrifice anything a more expensive hotel can offer. The rooms were decent sized. They were clean, and had all modern amenities. They offered complimentary breakfast. Croissants in the morning are fantastic. The hotel is only a few blocks from where the party is at on St. Denis street. If I got the street wrong, it's probably because we were too busy having fun to remember. There is no ice machine, but they give you packets of ice. It did the job. It's quiet during the night, which is nice for folks looking to escape the party. The only complant I had was they held the money on my credit card for a while and then released it without taking the payment. They then charged me again about a week later. That's not really that big a deal, but if you live paycheck to paycheck it can cause some headaches. When in Montreal you must: Visit a strip club (if you're from America). It's $5 cover, no one tips, and the girls were hot. I bought my girlfriend a lap dance for $15 and I got to watch! It was great! Visit Notre Dame. Have fun in there. Have A LOT of fun if you want to get sacrilegious. Check out the Bio-dome. It wasn't a must see, but it had a lot of cool animals, and plants. Party with the people! Straight, Gay, black, white, green...everybody gets along and has fun together. If you do stumble into a gay bar, be warned, they play hardcore porn on the t.v.! My sister's boyfriend was a bit skirmish when he realized. Have fun, feed the homeless kid with the two dogs. He keeps them healthier than himself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: The Staff was very helpful, they lent us an umbrella on a rainy day. The Bed was not very comfy. The Bathroom was big and clean. Location was nice, close to Berri station.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in the city!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisT392
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights and loved it! The staff were amazingly helpful and friendly and the hotel itself has a lot of character that would suit students and lighter travellers looking for a welcoming place to stay. We were really impressed with the location, free breakfast, free wifi, free parking and courtesy shown by everyone we met there and would not even hesitate to go back or recommend it to others. As many have said, it is a smaller place, but this just makes it extra cosy. Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Montreal spot”
Reviews.Author: Stars4449
Reviews.Content: We go to Montreal about once a year, and ALWAYS stay at the Chateau L'Argoat. It is a small European-style hotel: wonderful, warm friendly service, clean rooms, and ideally located across the street from a Metro stop and with dozens (possibly hundreds) of terrific, varied restaurants within a few blocks walking distance. And, it is very easy to get to by car, and has free parking. We drive there, leave the car, and don't use it till it's time to go home. There is free internet (though connection can be a bit flaky, depending on your room), and continental breakfast is included in the reasonable price. Why would we stay elsewhere?

Reviews.Title: “This charmer made my holiday”
Reviews.Author: INeedMoreFun
Reviews.Content: My visit to Montreal was wonderful and to come back to this place every night made it complete. My husband and I stayed at lArgoat for a week. I didn't know really what to expect and was found to be pleasantly surprised. Perfect location. Nice bedding, comfortable beds are important to me and this did not disappoint. The local made lavendar soap in the bathroom was so nice I even brought one home with me just as a lingering reminder. I don't think they liked that too much as the next day it was replaced with regular soap. I loved the breakfast room: the coffee, fresh pastries, muffins and bagels, the music, the wonderful service all very appreciated and so friendly. Thank you. I would definatly stay here again upon a return to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “On a pleasure visit to Montreal............”
Reviews.Author: NewtownSquareBaldies
Reviews.Content: My wife, grown daughter and I stayed here for three nights during the Thanksgiving Holiday weekend. My daughter selected the place after some internet seaching. The stay was very pleasant. The rooms we had was large and comfortable, and clean. The service at the hotel was above average. The location of the hotel is perfect for visitors. We had no trouble changing our plans and checking out earlier than expected- they were very accomodating. A highlight of this hotel is the morning breakfast. It is listed as a "continental" breakfast but is served in a very European fashion. Delicious muffins, croissants, bagels, juice, coffee, etc. all served by an extremely attentive waiter or waitress. Surprising good! I would definitely recommend. Only issue is that is close to Sherbrooke Street, a very busy street which leads to noise during the night (especially on Friday night). Try for a room that is NOT facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gomezaddams_10
Reviews.Content: To repeat what so many others have said: great location, friendly and helpful bilingual staff, close to attractions, and reasonable continental breakfast. If I return to Montreal, I'd surely try to book here. Just to cover some tips perhaps not cited: the Montreal metro is very easy to use, and quick. We saved a bundle on cabs, and I hate driving in a large and unfamiliar city - esp. when I don't speak the language. The metro station is at most one block away. Maps of the metro system are readily available, and are very easy to understand even if one speaks no French. There are multiple route lines with transfer stations, and the guide books tell you which metro station to use. But be aware - the system is not friendly to people with mobility problems! In regard to parking, I gave them my spare keys and kept my set. That way one can access your car to get or store belongings. Safe neighborhood near 2 universities. Be aware that Euro bed standards are smaller than US standards - roughly 6 inches narrower (verify for yourself). The continental breakfast is - consistent with the name itself, lighter and smaller than the typical US breakfast. Enjoy it for what it is, as you try a French lifestyle. It was tasty and well presented. There is no elevator, but staff were VERY helpful in regard to luggage.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveler5
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. It's location is close to the Metro and a few blocks walk to both the Latin Quarter and the Plateau with many sidewalk cafes and other eateries and shops, but since it is just on the edge of things, you aren't kept awake by any loud nightlife. They had free parking for our car, a very nice continental breakfast available for the entire morning (the best coffee!),and friendly, helpful staff. Our room was light and lovely, larger than anticipated, and we were very impressed with the modern art decorating the walls and hallways. This is not a big hotel so if you are interested in a more intimate ambiance, personalized service, and a great location for a very reasonable price, this is it! Would happily come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for friends”
Reviews.Author: KMason500
Reviews.Content: Two girlfriends and I visited Montreal and stayed in the two bedroom suite. It was perfect with the sofabed made up. The room was quaint with lovely wood panelling. The suite was described as two bedrooms separated by a bathroom, but in fact there was a passage between the rooms with one room with a sink and toilet and another with sink, shower and jacuzzi - so great for three people to get ready. Staff was friendly and helpful. I would stay there again. It is located close to subways and a wonderful area of restaurants and boutiques.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: jennifer s
Reviews.Content: Recently, a friend and I travelled to Montreal, and after one disastrous day in a nearby hotel, we stumbled upon this place and our trip took on a whole new brightness! The staff at the hotel were kind, funny, helpful and charming. The room in which we stayed was well appointed, had a 'faux fireplace', and a beautiful window. The brekky was tasty- coffee great. Couldn't have asked for a better location. After long days exploring Montreal, this was a restul and beautiful place to come 'home' to! Would (will) stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect intro to Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Hunterian
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided a fine welcome to Montreal - kind and friendly staff went out of their way to make us welcome. They told us something of the history of the hotel and gave us guidance on how to get around, including a free map. It is easy to find, the location is excellent and there is free parking. The breakfast was small but enough, particularly for people planning to enjoy Montreal's great food later in the day. We had one of the smallest rooms, but we didn't plan to spend much time in it. Everything was spotlessly clean and had everything we needed, including - most importantly - a super-comfy bed. If we were to visit Montreal again, we wouldn't look any further for an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value”
Reviews.Author: wybell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently and enjoyed the hotel and the surrounding neighbourhood. It is located on the plateau area of Montreal close to the shops of St. Denis and The Village. Our room was large with 2 queen beds and a Jaccusi bath. The room had a couch and a flat panel TV. The hotel is in 2 adjoining large mansions that have been converted. The breakfast was good with coffee, juice, fresh fruit, bagels, muffins, croissants and toast to name a few.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sswksq
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our first trip to Montreal in many, many years. It is an old converted house. I picked it because there was free parking and it was a fairly reasonable rate for Toronto. Our room was large and quite clean with a comfortable bed. It had the tiniest bathroom ever! It was on the 3rd floor and we missed having an elevator because we always haul way too much stuff. The breakfast room was also tiny and but they serve you the usual continental breakfast items. It is an easy walk to the Plateau Mont Royal area and Latin Quarter with their tons of restaurants and bars. There is also a Metro stop right across the street but it is very poorly maintained and we saw a bum was sleeping in the hall way to the ticketing area....My advise....go to the main entrance! Also there is a BIxi bike stand near-by where you can rent bikes self-service. All in all, it was a charming place to stay...as long as you don't need an elevator or a big bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Cabbagetowntoronto
Reviews.Content: Good choice at a reasonable price. Close to subway, restaurants, good location. Charming alternative to "big box" corporate hotels for someone who is looking a more intimate place to stay. Not many rooms and very busy, better book very early!

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJ729
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a great location close to old town and lots of great little restaurants...easy to walk most places...well kept nicely decorated rooms. Ours was small but it was the last available so good enough..Good breakfast. No complaints what so ever

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room. Convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: bebehi
Reviews.Content: We rented the suite with the two rooms. The master room has a queen bed (smaller than American queens) and a queen fold out couch and the second room has a queen bed. The two rooms are seperated by the room with the toilet and the room with the shower and jacuzzi. The second room is rather small, but I still loved the suite. The room is tastefully decorated with a chandelier in the master room. It's an older building, but this room has been renovated and kept well. They serve a Continental breakfast with really good bagels, wonderful yougurt and great coffee. The entrance to the Sherbrooke metro station is right across the street, and there are a lot of restaurants in that area...although, we ate at a very mediocre mediocre one. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a great location!”
Reviews.Author: kappyliu
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at l'Argoat based on the positive feedback on TripAdvisor. The hotel offered incredible value for a great location directly across from Sherbrooke station. We were able to walk just about everywhere with the exception of the Botanical Gardens and Olympic Stadium, which were both a quick drive down Sherbrooke. Parking was included; however, you do have to leave your keys with reception in case they have to move your car. We checked in right at three o'clock and got a spot close to the building. Our car was not moved during our two-night stay. Breakfast was mostly prepackaged stuff but was included in the price so I wouldn't complain. Our bathroom was quirky at best but honestly for the price, the l'Argoat can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel with fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: spider_legz
Reviews.Content: PROS: - friendly and accommodating staff, fluent in English and French - free parking - free high speed WIFI - free breakfast (mainly pastries - we preferred the bagels) - whirlpool bath fits two - entrance to the metro (subway) is directly across the street - bedding could be changed daily, if desired - comfortable bed - NO bed bugs CONS: - no ice machine; they could provide two reusable ice sheets per room, so we went out and bought ice. OTHER OBSERVATIONS: - booked the two bedroom suite with whirlpool bath - the first room was very spacious, but the second only had space for the bed and a very small (9-11") TV. This is fine, presuming you weren't coming to the city to watch TV. - sofa bed advertised in 2-bedroom suite was actually a very comfortable futon, though we only used it as a sofa. - in total, our party booked 3 rooms, including the 2-bedroom suite. Each was decorated differently, lending a bed & breakfast feel to the hotel. - we passed some used needles en route to the metro and we saw city workers cleaning up sharps as well. This is not a negative comment on the hotel, but thought to warn people to be cautious if wearing sandals or travelling with kids. - about 10-15 minutes from St-Catherine East. Much of the shopping and nightlife takes place on the West end, which can be along, casual walk, or a quick taxi ride. - a taxi from Crescent street at St-Catherine West (nightlife) cost about $10-11. We found it best to tell the taxi drivers the intersection (Sherbrooke and Berri) rather than the hotel name.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy. Good location”
Reviews.Author: Kermie9
Reviews.Content: One of my pet peeves of travelling with friends is that sometimes hotel reception disregards young guests. I felt when we checked in the hotel staff gave us the worst room in the building - perhaps feeling that we wouldn't complain or be repeat customers. The double room #4 was located right in the reception area and exposed to the street noise. Beware- if you ask for a double room, make sure it isn't this room before you get there. Apart from that the breakfast was average, location great, and price decent.

Reviews.Title: “Quel Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: Gogogadgets
Reviews.Content: Words cannot express how lovely our stay in Montreal has been, thanks largely to the chateau de l'argoat! The rooms are cute, clean, comfortable and bright; the bed was comfortable, the shower was hot, and the room was quiet; the staff is polite and helpful; the rooms are reasonably priced (which includes an ample breakfast selection available until 12 everyday). The medium sized room, while quite petite, suited our needs perfectly. We'd never stay anywhere else in Montreal again!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic first time experience in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: mark00771
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Trip Advisor, I'm not usually one to write reviews, but this hotel definately deserves one. I stayed here with my wife for two nights, our room was absolutely spotlessly clean. The decor was very pleasant with lovely original artwork and the air conditioning was almost silent. It is within ten to 15 minutes walk of the waterfront and downtown Montreal, there is parking available at the rear of the hotel, the Hotel owner holds your car keys to allow him to move your vehicle as other guest depart and arrive. Our car stayed in it's same spot for the two days so no problem. The breakfast was ample and delicious, with fresh coffee, bagels, pain au chocolat, toast and an assortment of jams and honey. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home.”
Reviews.Author: Mon1984
Reviews.Content: Dear travelers, My boyfriend and I found this wonderful hotel online and choose it because of location and past reviews. We arrived in a rain storm and were greeted with smiles. We checked in and loved the unique room we were given. Everyday we enjoyed a breakfast to start our day and then a quick walk to the Metro. I felt like I was headed back to my own apartment every night after a long day of adventures. The room was always made up looking like new. After the first night we decided to add on an additional stay and they were very helpful. It is very charming and will make you feel like you live in Montreal. Loved it! Hope to return in the future. -Monica (stayed from 7.18-7.23)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: montreal_92
Reviews.Content: For the price of the hotel room, You get even more than what you would expect. The room was spacious and comfortable and very clean! The staff was super friendly as well!! If you are looking for an inexpensive place to stay while visiting downtown montreal this is the place to go to. I have no complaints about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great value”
Reviews.Author: kotoanne
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Chateau de l'Argoat today and I'm very pleased with my hotel selection. I was a bit worried about driving into an unfamiliar city, but t's very easy to find, has free parking and free wi-fi, and is close to the Sherbrooke Metro station. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. My room (one of the smallest in the hotel) is indeed small, but nicely decorated and up-to-date. Even though it overlooks the busy street, it's very well soundproofed and street noise isn't a problem. I don't intend to spend a lot of time in my room, so the small size isn't a major concern. I don't think it would be possible to find another property with all the pluses that this one has at this price. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Jazzy Gem”
Reviews.Author: Zeebo1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Montreal where we experienced a week of the International Jazz Festival and numerous other attributes of the city. As we did two years ago, we stayed at the Chateau de l'Argoat and thankfully it has not changed. Still a unique hospitable establishment that feels like home. We recognized many of the staff from two years previous which is always a good sign. They continue to be interactive and friendly. Our third floor room was spotless, comfortable and extremely quiet. The continental breakfast is just enough to get one chugging along for the day - pains au chocolat, bagels, muffins, yogurt, juice, fruit and good strong coffee. Anyway, not much else to say other than we strongly recommend the Chateau de l'Argoat, particularly for people who want convenient access to the more colourful parts of the city such as the Latin Quarter, Little Italy, Mile End, the Village,and Old Montreal. Bon appetit!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DavidfromPA
Reviews.Content: We went to Montreal for the Jazz Festival and stayed at Chateau L'Argoat. The hotel was clean and comfortable and the room was a decent size. The beds were firm but comfortable and it was very quiet. Our room was right near one of the staircases but we never heard anyone outside the door and the double windows kept any street sounds out completely. Breakfast was served until noon and consisted of bread, bagels, muffins etc served by a waiter. The breakfast room only had seating for 10-11 but it was never over crowded for some reason. They also had a room with a computer that you could use and free wi-fi in all rooms though I found the computer they provided to be more than adequate to check email etc. We sayed in one of their rooms with 2 queen beds. Each room is a different size and so I cannot say if ours was bigger, smaller or about average in that regard. The staff was very friendly, they have free parking in a lot that is safe (I left my car unlocked for a couple of days and nothing was taken from it!) though you do have to leave your keys with them so they can move your car if needed. There is no pool or health club but we didn't miss those. The air conditioning worked very well in the room once we learned how to use the remote to work it. The location was fine for us, about a mile and a half from the Jazz Festival which we easily walked. We were 2 blocks from St. Denis which is a lively street with great restaurants. All in all it was a great vacation in a large part due to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: CTborn
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay, and have no complaints. Our 3rd floor room was a good size and fit our needs perfectly. Free parking and decent rates (especially compared to downtown and Old Montreal) are a big plus. The Sherbrooke metro stop was literally right across the street, and if you feel like walking, there are plenty of good restaurants in various neighborhoods within walking distance. All desk staff are bi-lingual and helpful, and the young men serving breakfast were very cordial.

Reviews.Title: “A nicely priced, beautiful place with a perfect location and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Shirley15126
Reviews.Content: Four of us (family with adult children) stayed for 2 nights and enjoyed it more than we could have imagined. It was easy to find and in a great location for catching the metro or walking to parks or to a great variety of restaurants and stores. The price made it a great find for us. The staff was very helpful with recommendations as to what is available in the area and how to get there. We will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Reminds me of the pension in A Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: violetvale
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Chateau de l'Argoat. It's like a big house with lots of rooms, steep staircases and narrow hallways. The rooms vary a lot--the green room I had this time (#22) has a cute chandelier and is spacious for one person; the yellow room (#14 I think) is the best room I've had so far because it was pretty big and I liked the decor. The room I had was spotless and there's free wifi. I really like their lavender soap (it smells so good and has little scrubby bits in it). The water pressure in my room was fairly weak--that would be the one negative. I forgot the German novel I was reading at home, and there was a little table on one of the landings with used books in many different languages, including a book of German short stories--you could imagine that travellers from everywhere over the years left these books behind. It's right across the street from Sherbrooke metro. Walk 10 minutes for the *best* roasted chicken dinner at Romados (get the spicy version) and some Portuguese pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Eclectic but Odd, Not Really a Boutique Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: alexanderSIMPLE
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my significant other. In this hotel, we felt like we were playing a game.. We constantly felt like we were watched and discussed by the staff, perhaps judged, but hopefully not. The staff, too, seemed like they were "playing House" in a very cute but not very professional manner. For example, breakfast was served in a tiny room with a menu on the wall. A handsome and sweet-voiced young man would come out with a tray and ask what you would like... but he would merely bring you something that, if he had not been there that morning, you could have grabbed yourself from another hall-kitchen type of room. Examples aside, here's the breakdown: Parking - you have to give your keys to the front desk and they have control of your car. They do not valet it, but they need keys in case of an emergency. Check In - The process is great, very friendly, but sometimes too friendly as they want to know a lot about you to get to know you. It's an experience kinda like when two people meet for the first time and decide if they want to be friends... just a preference question if that's good or bad. Business Center - Internet access is provided at a computer station that is very old, but that's completely normal by small hotel standards. Room - We stayed in a large room, but it was on the third floor. Keep in mind that there is no elevator and the building is at least a hundred years old. It's a tiresome climb, with strange decor of all the times in the last century. Our room had a huge bathroom, but it was by architectural purpose. The building was not always a hotel, so some rooms are larger than others. The room was quiet with a view of the parking lot. Water pressure and cleanliness was adequate but we felt like we were inside a game of Clue with the decor. As an added bonus, we got to see a mouse in the room... but the front desk didn't think much of it. Maybe it was something I don't understand, but I wanted to cancel my last night of the stay at that point, to no avail. Location - The outside area is great. It's close to a subway station but feels safe and city-like. There is plenty of things to do and a great dining spot is "L'Academie", where you can bring your own wine. This hotel needs better management, in our opinion. I thought this was an amazing find and truly looked forward to the trip. Overall, the rooms are not cheap... and it makes sense to splurge just a bit more on something more professional.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel, had excellent service”
Reviews.Author: voyageons
Reviews.Content: I had been planning to write a review on this hotel and never got around to it but the previous review re bedbugs has prompted me to write. Finding this hotel on Trip Advisor made me a big fan of this website because Chateau de l'Argoat was not listed on the usual travel websites and there were many glowing reviews here about this small hotel. We were not disappointed. The location was great, with good restaurants within easy walking distance, ranging from L'Evidence for breakfast to the incredible Spanish tapas bistro Pinxto in the Plateau area. The Metro stop is across the street, and the hotel offers free parking (we ended up never moving our car because using the Metro was so easy.) Don't expect a fancy lobby; in fact, there isn't really a lobby at all. The hotel seems to be made of two houses connected to each other, so there is a big variety of rooms. We stayed in one with the tiniest bathroom we had ever seen in a hotel, and another with a standard size bathroom, but both with new fixtures. (There are also large suites in the hotel--a cheerful maid showed me a just-vacated one she was cleaning.) We found the decor in the rooms rather charming, like a "homey" B&B. I was very surprised to read the bed bug review, and found the owner's response interesting. We actually found all the staff to be more responsive and friendlier than what the previous reviewer unfortunately experienced. The desk clerks were always very helpful; they gave knowledgeable directions and suggestions, they let us keep food in the refrigerator, and Alain even let my daughter take home a music poster that was up on the wall of the computer room (there is also a bin of giveaway posters of past events in this room and, this being Montreal, there's some striking designs.) We may have reason to be in Montreal regularly, and would most likely choose to stay here as first choice if no other bedbug allegations surface.

Reviews.Title: “look no more for comfort, convenience and quality...”
Reviews.Author: canadas333
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on and off during our five week vacation...the rooms were clean,tidy and definately worth the price. The morning breakfast was just fine...juice..coffee..some pastries and muffins...a great way to start the day...they were more than accomodating with our car as well...eventhough they don't have enough parking for all of their visitors we were able to leave it there for a few days..they have a freindly cat that sometimes visits in the evenings...check out their posters in the lounge area...we still have a great one with the purple hippo on our living room wall...merci for everything...i will be back!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: sharroncarson
Reviews.Content: good value. very roomy. although i think the decor in the second smaller bedroom of the suite needs to be brought in line to match the main bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TR22
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a business trip since it was 1/2 the cost of the downtown hotels. A beautiful little place within a block of a metro stop and several blocks from the Latin Quarter (where you will never go hungry)! They served a wonderful petit-dÃ©jeuner of pastries, juice and coffee and had free internet access in a little sitting room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this place!!

Reviews.Title: “A friendly, centrally located and inexpensive place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: CircusBoy2
Reviews.Content: The Chateau de l'Argoat was a perfect place to stay in Montreal. It has a great location by a lot of restaurants and bars. You can easily walk to Old Town, downtown and explore the St. Laurent/St. Denis street scene. It's also right by a subway station. The hosts were very helpful and friendly. Don't expect an American style hotel, it's an older building with slightly smaller rooms and a fairly small bathroom, but to us, that was part of the charm. Also, it's quite inexpensive. About the only flaw was that their internet/computer service seemed a little past its' due date. All in all, I couldn't recommend it more, especially if you don't want to spend a ton of money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Travlin_boy
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at Lâ€™Argoat. The rooms were generally nice, clean, and the bathrooms were impressive. The hotel is conveniently located in the Latin Quarter and near a metro and Bixi station and a supermarche is nearby too. Lâ€™Argoat is a bike-friendly hotel, so we were able to rent bikes and leave them locked safely in a storage area. One downcheck weâ€™d give Lâ€™Argoat is their breakfast and waitstaff. We tried their continental breakfast one of our mornings and found the waitstaff to be quite rude and the breakfast to consist of flavorless items. Donâ€™t waste your time with breakfast here as thereâ€™s a great breakfast shop three blocks north. We would definitely recommend staying at Lâ€™Argoat. Room 12 was great as the bathroom was amazing and it faced away from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Wanted”
Reviews.Author: jervis76
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with a Queen bed and small bathroom for our 5 night stay and found the hotel ideal. The room was well decorated, clean and comfortable and although the small bathroom was indeed small it was fine for our needs. The continental breakfast was fine and the staff were all friendly and helpful. Given the small size of the hotel combined with the friendliness of the staff and decor the feel of the hotel was much more homely and personal than in bigger hotels. We were happy with the location too, close to Rue St Denis with plenty of bars and restaurants in either direction along there. There's a metro station around the corner which had us at the old town within 15 minutes of leaving the hotel. If you fancy a long walk, we did it one day back from the riverside in the old town to the hotel and it took around 45 minutes. The only negative I could find is that the breakfast room is small so you won't necessarily find a table. On our first four mornings we were fine, twice managing to get the last table but on the last morning the room was full so we went back up to our room to wait. As we had plenty of time before we had to set off it wasn't a problem but could have been an inconvenience if we'd needed to be somewhere. Other than that though we were more than happy with the Chateau L'Argoat and enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: mssqueaks
Reviews.Content: My friends and I picked this hotel based on the positive reviews. Living in New York City, I am totally on guard and aware of the huge bed bug problem everywhere. I arrived prepared to search the room for anything suspicious, and unfortunately I came face to face with my first bed bug at this hotel. The bed was on a wooden platform, and when we lifted the box spring, we could see dark flecks and then the bug itself. (Every traveler should read up on how to search a room and what to look for. Be prepared!) Both the mattress and the box spring were enclosed in high-end encasements, which is an excellent thing to see at a hotel. However, it was a also a red flag that they've been dealing with this problem off and on for a while. Thankfully we had left some luggage in the car while we searched, and the rest was placed in the bathtub (the safest place in a hotel room). After calming down from my subsequent panic attack, we went to alert management of the situation. Both gentlemen seemed to be nice people, but I was not impressed with how they handled the situation. We were offered some "spray" and told there were no other rooms to switch to. I stated that there was absolutely NO WAY we could stay in that room and then risk bringing the bugs back home with us, and that we would have to find a new hotel. Just spraying something would not have solved any level of infestation. I also offered to show them what we had found and where, but they were totally uninterested in checking things out. Management was polite as we piled out of the hotel, but I tried to emphasize how much they needed to get a serious professional exterminator in there. They were shockingly complacent about the whole situation. I'm 100% sure that they rented our room to someone else later that night since it was a busy holiday weekend. I understand that bed bugs are a problem and that it's possible to run into them practically anywhere. I was mostly bothered by their apathetic reactions, and I was unconvinced that they would actually do anything about the situation going forward. Travelers beware!

Reviews.Title: “A good value with comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: katiekins570
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location--it was easy to walk to great restaurants and nightlife, and it was across from a metro station for easy access pretty much anywhere. The room was spacious (VERY spacious, with a huge walk-in closet), which was good because we had a lot of stuff. It was decorated more like someone's spare bedroom than a hotel, but that was fine. It was actually very pleasant and homey. We found it quite comfortable. The free wi-fi and parking were great perks as well. The continental breakfast was just lame enough that they probably shouldn't have bothered, but hey, free bananas. We didn't really care as we're not big breakfast eaters anyway. The hotel staff could be brusque and a bit rude, but at the price we were paying for a comfortable room in a great location, we really didn't care. The hotel seems to cater to cyclists, so perhaps if that is your niche, you will especially like it.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Inviting, Pleasant...”
Reviews.Author: Kriscleo55
Reviews.Content: The Chateau de l'Argoat was a great little place to stay for two first time Montreal travelers. The atmosphere was very European, nicely decorated, and bright. The hotel is centrally located; we walked to Old Montreal in about 20 minutes. There is a wide array of great restaurants within a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The free parking lot was good to have. Our room was bright, neat and had a couch, TV and whirlpool bath. However, it did have a very musty smell that lasted throughout the duration of our stay. Both concierges that we dealt with were extremely friendly and helpful. Their English was very good. They recommended lots of great places to eat and see. The only complaint we have is that the man that served breakfast was very rude and arrogant. He spoke English perfectly, yet he was unwilling to help us read the French menu. He seemed to treat other English speakers in a similar way. Other than that, our stay was great and we would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: GT67
Reviews.Content: Wonderful boutique hotel - beautiful art on the walls and nice rooms, very clean. The staff, with the exception of one snippy/condescending breakfast server, were wonderful - very helpful and friendly. Within a 5 minute walk in different directions you have the Latin Quarter (Greenwich Village-like with GREAT food and shops), a Metro station and a small grocery store for whatever you might need. Would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place with bonus features!”
Reviews.Author: RoseOfMexico
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night as they didn't have room for us to stay longer, unfortunately. The staff was very pleasant - their english is good enough to get by - so if you know french, that'll help! The place has a couple of little "extras" that most hotels in town do not offer: free wi-fi, free breakfast, and free parking. These features will certainly save you some serious cash. (parking can be as much as $25/nite in montreal!) The rooms are on the smaller side (not like the American hotels I am used to) but decorated very nicely, with the standard TV/bathroom (bathroom is small too) but everything is clean and tastefully decorated in warm colors. The "hot spots" of downtown are nearby (from crescent street it is maybe an $8 cab ride), and the subway is about 2 1/2 blocks away if you'd rather do that. RE: breakfast, it is not a room full of muffins, toast, etc. that you help yourself to, a waitress comes in and takes your order (menu posted on wall). The menu consists of some simple things: croissants, bagels, etc. There is fruit and coffee there to help yourself to. Overall, a very nice, clean place that I would definitely stay at again. (PS. tipping in Canada is the same as tipping in the US: 15% to 20%)

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Donna057
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at this charming hotel and could not have been more pleased. Our first floor room was beautiful...clean and tastefully decorated with a large bathroom and whirlpool. The neighborhood was surprisingly quiet even though we had a room in front. Handy location to Metro and numerous restaurants nearby. Free parking and a continental breakfast are included making this a very good value for Montreal. The staff was always eager to assist. If you are looking for a unique, small hotel with all the charm of those in Europe, this is it. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and helpful”
Reviews.Author: flute62
Reviews.Content: The desk staff at L'Argoat were very helpful and nice. When we needed help with finding things like the place where they got their coffee in the morning and finding a certain Jazz Festival concerts, they went out of their way to show us on a map where it was. Some of the staff do not speak English as well as others so sometimes they deferred us to someone else. The rooms were very clean and were air conditioned. Our room was quiet also. Breakfast was not bad (coffee, tea, fruit, croissant, muffin). Good coffee, but free only in the morning. Pastries were store bought when we came on the first day, but they were making their own muffins by the next day. You did have to order your breakfast from your room or at the table downstairs because they do heat things up.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: pridefulswagger
Reviews.Content: Free parking, wonderful staff, free breakfast, clean rooms, and a BALCONY? What an excellent choice for three nights in Montreal! My friend and I got very lucky with our room, we had a balcony facing the street. Very close to the Latin Quarter and nice places to visit at night, within walking distance to just about anything you need. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, always willing to answer any questions we had. It was a quiet hotel with a lot of charm and character. The bathroom and room was small but fastidiously cleaned and vacuumed. I would certainly stay here again! The price was right, but what we got for the price was even better!

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking interior, but stained and moldy smelling room.”
Reviews.Author: jaimelovebug
Reviews.Content: It was a good light breakfast and pretty staircases inside. However, our room carpet was sticky and stained everywhere. I had to open the windows to get fresh air since it smelt very musty. Was a bit expensive and far from downtown Montreal to spend as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in someone's home”
Reviews.Author: Rip1476
Reviews.Content: Chateau de l'Argoat is in a gorgeous old building that is in an excellent location in Montreal. We had a large room facing the street that was well appointed. There is a metro station a block away and with the day pass you can really explore Montreal. We did walk down to the old city and St. Denis is a short walk away if you want night life. The staff was very nice and helpful. The breakfast was enough to get you started on your day. Free parking is a plus in Montreal. Unless you want luxury I can't think of a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place. We were very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: JasonManikel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chateau for a couple of nights during a weekend trip to Montreal. We were very pleased. The room was very large and comfortable - even if there were a few "interesting" decorating points. The staff were very friendly - especially about helping us with breakfast in the morning (included!). The location is superb - right near the metro and very close to Rue St Denis - with lots of great restaurants and nightlife. The proximity to the nightlife is really the only drawback. Not a particularly quiet place on a weekend. Oh, free wireless!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, excellent service and spacious room!”
Reviews.Author: Bacidisole
Reviews.Content: I recommend Chateau L'Argoat when staying in Montreal. Chateau de L'Argoat offered much more than we expected and truly enhanced our stay. Making a reservation by phone turned out to be easy and stressless, and Alain efficiently provided us with an email confirmation. First of all, the location was fabulous. Although we chose the hotel for the price and the Sherbrooke metro stop across the street, we had too much fun walking Rue St. Denis, Rue St. Laurent and Rue Sherbrooke to be lazy. We liked knowing that the metro was right there, but we often walked to a farther metro stop to enjoy the cityscape. We were minutes away from Vieux Montreal and Centre-Ville and navigated the city easily. Plus, we felt safe walking home from the clubs and bars on Rue Ontario and Rue St. Denis - even late in the evening. The hotel offers 3 things that were important for us -1) a safe place to park our car without a charge. The parking lot is like logic puzzle, but our car was easy to retrieve once we were ready to leave. 2) free wi-fi, we enjoyed being able to use our netbook to research the next site/restaurant to visit, athough the hotel does offer a stand alone unit for people to check email or whatnot. 3) free breakfast - the breakfast was perfect, served by friendly staff, which includes coffee, tea, fruit and the choice of muffins, toast, and the excellent Fairmount/St. Viatour bagels that are a Montreal must-have. Our room, #36, was located on the third floor and included two spacious queen beds and a huge bathroom. There was a gigantic whirlpool and a standard shower stall. There is no elevator, so that is something to keep in mind if you like a lot of luggage or have difficulty with stairs. Although the staff does offer assistance, if needed. We did not have any problem with noise, although our friend in a room on the main part of the hotel on the second floor did experience noise discomfort from the stairs. I personally enjoyed our artwork in our room and loved the character and non-chain hotel ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Backstreets_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a block or 2 from the Sherbrooke subway station and from St. Denis street which is a very good street for walking/shopping/dining. There's a rental car office atop the subway station if needed. You're 3 subway stops from Old Town and 6 stops from the Bell Centre and you can stay on the orange line and not change trains. Our room was very clean, cozy and came with wireless internet access. Bathroom looked new and included high quality soap and shampoo. The hotel has a secure entry (locked at night) and the staff were very friendly. Coffee, fruit and pastries are provided in the cafe for breakfast. The $16 airport bus (L'Aerobus) drops you at the Berri subway station which is 1 stop from Sherbrooke. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, loved the free amenities, and cafe-syle breakfast”
Reviews.Author: spottedbat
Reviews.Content: This wonderful hotel was a perfect choice for us! I traveled with my mother in-law. The room we happened to get had a back bedroom, so she was able to stay up late reading and i could just go to bed! each room had a tv. the beds were very comfortable and clean. the bathroom was wonderful and the tub was huge! The free internet/parking/breakfast made this place even more worth it! I will definately be back. The coffee they serve is delicious (tasted like the home roasted kind my husband makes). They told me it is roasted locally from a nearby shop and they buy small quantities at a time. Now that is the way coffee should be! Many places just dont care. The orange juice was delicious as well! Everyday, they didn't mind boiling up some water to put in my mother-in-law's thermos so she could have tea all day! The room we stayed in didn't have carpet, so it would be great for someone who may have allergies. However, i highly recommend bringing slippers! I stubbed my toe on the wooden board on the base of the bed. We would remove our shoes in the room or else we would track slush everywhere! So at least bring a spare pair of shoes to wear inside. Wonderful service, friendly staff. We had a room directly in front of the hotel and next to the entrance, and it wasn't as loud as some people described. I always bring a machine the makes white noise anyways in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good option, but not a "highlight" of our trip”
Reviews.Author: Dadeeoh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Montreal this past summer and stayed for 8 days in total. We booked early and were able to secure "Room 26", a large room at the back of the hotel. The room was nice, clean, well maintained throughout our stay, and very quiet. Some of the furnishings weren't at the very peak of modern fashion and the room itself didn't have any more character than you would expect from a typical hotel room, but on the whole we had nothing to complain about. The hotel itself was quite similar to our room - perhaps needing a renovation to keep pace with a new modern hotel, but it was clean, well maintained, and decorated with some quite wonderful pieces of art. We were always greeted warmly on arrival, and the employees were helpful in giving us directions, offering advice, or just generally being informed on the surrounding area and attractions. In particular, the manager (didn't catch his name but he had a mustache when we were there) was terrific. Breakfast was the largest disappointment with Chateau L'Argoat. My wife and I stayed in a full B&B in Quebec City, our previous stop, and were expecting something along those lines for food service, even though we knew we were receiving a continental-style breakfast. Breakfast is, in fact, just a pastry of some sort (muffins, toast, croissant, bagels, etc.) that was obviously store bought, with coffee, tea, or juice to drink. We always had enough to eat and never left the hotel hungry, but by the end of our stay we were opting for just a coffee and looking elsewhere for something to eat. The service was, as with the rest of the hotel, terrific, and the food itself was fine, but we expected more. I don't know whether to call this a failing or just mis-aligned expectations. Location-wise, Chateau L'Argoat is just about the perfect combination of close to the night life but not too close. It is about a two to three block walk to Rue St. Denis's, on of the major night-life destinations in Montreal. We were in town during Just for Laughs, and St. Denis was quite busy most nights, so the extra distance meant that we slept well while someone staying at a hotel right on St. Denis most likely would not have. We were also a very short walk from the Metro station, and perhaps 20-30 minutes walking to downtown Montreal and the Vieux Port. We walked pretty much everywhere, and were happier for it. To sum up my review, I would return to Chateau L'Argoat again when we return to Montreal. The location was terrific, the rooms satisfactory, and the service friendly, warm, and helpful. For the price it is certainly worth it.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable well located accommodation”
Reviews.Author: micva
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an old building which has been updated with current fixtures, is clean and has original art throughout giving it a pleasant atmosphere. my room, which had quite a small window, faced the back of the hotel looking out over the back alley through a corridor of two brick walls - the low light level made it a bit dreary during the day even though it was painted bright yellow. the sleeping room was spacious, the bathroom very small and the closet contained a good-sized safe. cleanliness was very good. the hotel is well located near transport, clubs, bars & restaurants on rues st. denis and st. laurent. breakfast which is included is basic continental & is a little on the skimpy side. I had little interaction with staff, but they seemed courteous & informative.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Galstonlad
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Chateau twice over the past few years and I can honestly say I would never stay anywhere else when in Montreal. It looks like a converted mansion with all of the fireplaces and crown moulding from a long time ago. The rooms are nice and big, the staff are really helpful and even include a small breakfast you can eat downstairs or take to your room. Location is a short walk to the latin quarter and downtown is close too. The price is right, alot cheaper than the big chain hotels. It is becoming my home in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden wonder!”
Reviews.Author: MeganV4
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly not very many people are familiar with this little treasure... located on the very popular Sherbroolke Street .... it is just a minutes walk from the Latin quarter of Montreal... so shopping, theatre, museums and dining are within waking distance. The staff are friendly and know enough english to easily assist guest who do not understand french... Taxi's are very easy to get as this hotel is just across from the Grande Plaza ... There is always at least two parked outside there. The subway (metro) is also close by and easy to use. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: MassTraveler78
Reviews.Content: We visited Montreal October 22-24 and couldn't have been more pleased with our stay at LArgoat. From reception to departure, it was excellent. The rooms were quiet, the bathrooms small yet functional. Breakfast was OK and the Living Room had a common desk top computer to check emails on. Parking around back was included. If you are going to Montreal to spend time in the city rather than your room, L'Argoat is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: zooboo1
Reviews.Content: The weather during our early October visit to Montreal was quite chilly. Some might even say cold. When I told the concierge that our room was cold and requested the heat be turned on, I was told that 'heat would not be available until the following week'. Had it not been for this serious lack of service, I would classify this hotel as average as the room was small, clean but adequate. I was greatly surprised by the number of effusive reviews as the Chateau de l'Argoat lacks charm and does not provide particularly good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Find. Wouldn't stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: LaChatteNoire
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here over the Labor Day weekend, in the cheapest, smallest room available (we spent all our money on food) and were pleasantly surprised to see that the room size was more than adequate. Small bathroom, but everything was clean..except for a few stains on the comforter, but I'm not hugely fussy. The staff was very friendly and informative, plus all spoke good-to-proficient English. The parking situation was a dream, and the location, perfect. The Wi-Fi was a little spotty, but no big deal. We will definitely stay here next time and not take a gamble ever again-and believe me, Montreal has some hideous hotels hiding under the guise of a slick facade. Just stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A reason to go come back to Montreal”
Reviews.Author: ManettiChicago
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Montreal and the Chateau Del'Argoat was a pleasant surprise. The service was very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself was nice and quiet although it's on a main street. The room was very clean but just a little cramped for four people. The location was great. The metro was across the street, although we walked almost everywhere. It is very centrally located, with many restaurants, clubs and bars just steps away. The parking was a plus also. We parked our car on the first day and didn't use is again until we left four days later. The breakfast was O.K. We would have a coffee or juice and something small, but the best part was walking a block or two to a cafe and having coffee and a coissant outside, while people watching. My husband and I plan to come back to Montreal ourselves and we would definitely stay here .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: garyschne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful establishment for three nights. Our room was bright and lovely, clean, and large, with an exceptionally large bath which had an oversized tub. The common areas are nicely decorated, and the staff very welcoming and friendly. We particularly appreciated the secure off street parking, located at the back door of the hotel. The continental breakfast was good, but the dining area did tend to get quite crowded, which was no more than a minor inconvenience at most. The location is perfect, particularly if you enjoy walking. One block away from Rue St. Denis, which has restaurants and shops that seemingly go on for miles. About twenty minutes walk to Old Town Montreal, which made for a great way to burn off some of the calories consumed at the wonderful restaurants located there. We also walked to Park Mount Royal, which was approximately thirty minutes away. Climbing to the top of Mount Royal revealed a fabulous place with spectacular views of the city. I would heartily recommend this hotel to anyone who enjoys the benefits, amenities, and personal touch to be found in a smaller establishment over the impersonality of large hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful and friendly staff at a great price”
Reviews.Author: 604global
Reviews.Content: Some of the benefits of staying at Chateau de l'Argoat are: 1.Extremely helpful and friendly staff 2. The hotel is centrally located 3. Subway station across the street 4. Excellent restaurants nearby on St Deny st 5. Delicious continental breakfast 6. Free parking 7. Clean rooms The only con I had against the hotel was the bed was a little firmer then I like. Overall my wife and would stay at Chateau de l'Argoat again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: etravelhome
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room #22... there was lots of room to move around even with 2 adults and a small child. Bathroom is compact, but it's very new (and clean!) and efficient. Free parking in the back (they will likely hold your keys because of tandem parking). Breakfast is continental, but it's not self-service. There's a gal who warms the muffins and croissants, etc., so that added service touch is nice. There's usually fruit available as well, and my husband (who is a coffee snob) actually liked the coffee. Great value. Subway is across the street. You're a block from St Denis where there are a million restaurants and great nightlife. We walked everywhere (it's a mile or so to Old Montreal).

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Siumee
Reviews.Content: Though the hotel looks old outside, it is beautiful inside. Our room looked exactly the same as that appeared on their website. Free wireless internet is provided in room. The front desk service was fast. Every staff we dealt with spoke good English. They responded positively to our comments very quickly. The breakfast is very nice with orange juice, fruit, coffee and different kinds of bagels, muffins, etc. There is a beautiful and polite young lady to serve you. You make your orders and she heats the bagel, muffins, etc. to make them tasty for you. You can also re-order and even have your breakfast served inside your room! Travel information is provided in room & posted at the breakfast area. We regret that we did not take a look at it earlier and missed a museum package with great value which included free visits to over 30 museums and a 3 days travel pass. The 3-day travel pass costs CAD17 itself and can be used on Bus & Metro networks. The hotel is only a 2-minute walk to the Sherbrooke Metro Station. We have no difficulty at all in getting to all attractions with the travel pass.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: clester
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent 2 nights. We were there to visit McGill Univ. The location was great. Once there we didn't move the car til time to leave. We walked everywhere we needed to go. Mcgill is about 1 mile and we loved the "Rue Saint Denis" area (about 5 min walk). Lots of bars, grills, a movie theater and the like. Seemed like a very trendy area. Our room was the 2 bed with whirlpool bath. We wanted the smaller 2 bedroom but it was booked. This room was great. A very big bedroom, flat screen, large bathroom. It was sort of like a B&B. and very quaint. Staff was friendly and spoke english when needed (all the time form me :) This is the place to stay. Avoid the big chains.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gibberellin
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small hotel, at a reasonable price for a big city. An old converted-house style of place. Clean comfortable home-style rooms. The large-bathroom (it's very large) room is well worth the extra $5. Friendly and helpful staff. Continental breakfast non-notable but OK. Parking multi-rowed, but a highly valued asset in a city with very limited parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Aime_voyager87
Reviews.Content: I got one of the rooms facing the street. I was tired and slept well, but mornings are noisy. Room is comfortable but small. Bathroom is tiny. Very close to the subway and on the fringes of downtown (Montreal downtown is big, so some might consider it a downtown place). Breakfast is very simple - juice, coffee or tea, fresh fruit, toast, muffins or bagel, so if you stay several days it is boring - and service was not fast. Breakfast room is tiny, only four tables, very close to each other, so you feel you should eat as quickly as possible and get out of there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Chateau de l'Argoat, would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: aljebedi
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff from the moment we made reservations. Very helpful when calling for directions to the hotel. Room and bathroom were very clean upon arrival. Free wireless internet which worked very well. Location was great, a 2 minute walk to Metro Station and lots of restaurants and bars close by on Rue St. Denis. Breakfast was a good selection of bagels, muffins, breads, croissants, juice and coffee, all very fresh. Plenty of available parking behind hotel. A very pleasant experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to be for a romantic night.”
Reviews.Author: Fumus
Reviews.Content: PREFACE: I searched and search for the right hotel, I compared prices, I looked at location, I did it all. I was limited though, my gf told me that she wanted a "romantical night"(haha!), so we needed a jacuzzi, a large bed, wine and isolation. I thought Montreal in the Winter time, you can get anymore isolated and alone than that. It was so. I booked online via e-mail with Argoat, it was $120 for the Queen sized bed and double whirlpool bath. MY TRIP: I drove my fat American butt up from Albany,NY(USA) to Montreal(About 3.5 hours). I decided that a GPS was a waste of money, and probably just a hassle if I borrowed my mom's. So I didn't...yea, I got lost. Big time. The only number I had and the only person I knew, was Gilles at the Chateau. I called the Chateau and I spoke with Gilles who was working there. He was the nicest and most patient person in the world after being lost for 2 hours on the phone with Gilles, we became good friends..haha. The only thing about him was that he had an accent. So awhile of driving I got close to the hotel, I thought Gilles was telling me to turn on "saint duber street". I was drove all over and I called him back 3 or 4 times but I never saw a "saint duber" on the right or left side. I said, can you spell the street name for me...it was "Saint Hubert"...hahaha! THE HOTEL: So yea, after that little mishap I arrived at the hotel. It was just like I had read about. It was small, it felt cozy like someone's house. You just feel comfortable there, safe, it reminds you of home. The room was done tastefully, the bed was nice, really nice. We got alot of use out if...if you know what I'm saying. The hot tub (which is not in the pictures) was a lot of fun. We couldn't figure out how to get it work, we called the front desk. The guy came up, he thought it was broken. Turns out he had never used it before. He was going to upgrade our room from the one we had to the other larger jacuzzi suite. Then he figured it out, there's a special button on the top of the tub. You won't notice it, it looks almost hidden. Anyways, it worked. I had my romantical night with my lady. The TUB and BATHROOM ARE HUGE! There's a walkin shower too(If you are really interested PM me, I have a video I took of the room) The TV is small but if you are staying there for the reasons I was, you won't be watching TV. It did have a DVD player which I used to play some jazz and other romantical music. Also, parking was easy and free. FOOD: It was minus 5 degrees or less with the wind. So I didn't walk around at night or the next day. It took all the courage my gf and I had just to go across the street to the Hilton. At the Hilton is where I ate dinner and it was delicious! I had a chicken burger, a turkey club sandwhich, and some french onion soup. Our server there was hilarious, a real character. The bill came to around 50 sumtin Canadian for 3 drinks(alcohol), a soup, and an 2 entrees. Great deal, considering I would have payed double for that quality they offered. The breakfast at the Chateau was also as described here. It was amazing. The coffee and juice was really good. I had a muffin, crepes, toast, haha, everything. NO WONDER I'm a fat american!! THANK YOU!! CHATEAU de L'Argoat!

Reviews.Title: “What a great time!”
Reviews.Author: SetzersDelilah
Reviews.Content: We had originally intended to stay elsewhere while in Montreal but we found Chateau De L'Argoat after we were screwed out of our intended destination. Though we were choosing a hotel by running out of the car and checking rooms/prices, L'Argoat was a perfect find. The rooms are decently cheap, but vary heavily, from an odd smaller room with an unattached (but private) bathroom (just the one room, a victim of the older architecture), to sunny, queen bed and jacuzzi affairs. It being late we opted for the jacuzzi, which still put the room down cheaper than our original booking. L'Argoat has three floors, attached by stairs. There is no elevator or handicapped ramp. The only problem we had all stay was with the heat. With the outdoors so cold, the Quebecois like it hot, and we couldn't seem to make heater go below sub-tropical. Cracking a window was a quick and very effective fix. Breakfast in the morning is simple and french, baked goods brought to order and coffee tea and juice. If you're really hungry you'll have to head out into Montreal, which is probably why you're there anyway. The desk staff were friendly and courteous, and basically run the entire place. Housekeeping is separate, but the desk staff are also your parking attendants and waiters for breakfast. The parking situation is a little house party style (but it was free). You have to leave your keys at the desk because the lot out back can only fit enough cars if they park people in. We decided to trust them and they didn't ding up anything while we were there. But I could see it being inconvenient if you were in a hurry. The parking is also off of an un-plowed back alley, in Montreal. So if the forecast says snow, leave your car in one of the covered lots down the street, or you'll be extending your stay a little while while the city thaws.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: Modesttraveller30
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night in September of 2008. No complaints. Great service, comfortable room and very conveniently located. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will stay again”
Reviews.Author: bluesapphire78
Reviews.Content: We were happy off the bat that the Chateau offered parking as that seems to be a rarity in big cities. The parking is unique in the back so you have to give them your car keys so that they can move cars around if needed. The counter staff were helpful when we were looking to find a place we were interested in going. I was extremely pleased with the room. We stayed in room four, which is on the ground floor, and is actually two rooms. Perfect for two friends traveling together as we each had our own tv and privacy. The bed was very comfortable and I loved the down pillows. I really liked the hardwood floors, wall colour, mouldings and room chandelier. The continental breakfast was awesome, with the best bagels ever. It is located in such a convenient location and I recommend people using the subway if they are going to the shopping district. I plan to stay here again and recommend it to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: ebarav
Reviews.Content: Was at conference in Montreal for a week, and wanted somewhere small and convient at good price. This place was great. The location good, opposite metro station near bus station and walking distance to latin and village quarters. Staff at reception amazing and very helpful friendly. Room ( 24) a little orange/red for my taste but clean and quiet. Breakfast simple and in good atmosphere, definitly enough to start the day. Again back to reception staff , very accomadating and nothing too much bother ( left my case there for four days as went on side trip to Washington DC). Art in Hotel is great. Am in Montreal every 2 years for conference and will be back here.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS - BEWARE!!!”
Reviews.Author: sydneystevo
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, excellent location, everything was fine until I got struck by bed bugs!!! Avoid room 7 which is the one just left of the reception area. There are two rooms, the bugs struck in the main bedroom. Happened on 2 October 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RonVancouver
Reviews.Content: We had the large room on the main floor in the front of the hotel with a jetted tub. The room was large and comfortable. A nice sitting area and a new TV. The bath had both the jetted tub and a shower. Even though it overlooked Sherbrooke St. , it was not noisy. The best part of the hotel were the friendly front desk staff. The young lady that greeted us when we arrived was so friendly and helpful with lots of suggestions on what to do and see that evening. The chap that checked us out was also very friendly. The morning breakfast was ok, but nothing to get excited about.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: TravelinGrannyTexas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights at L'Argoat and found it fit our requirements perfectly: small & quiet; free parking; internet access; metro stations nearby (one right across the street, another about a 3 blk walk); good continental breakfast in quaint little breakfast room; interesting neighborhood with lovely Parc la Fontaine within easy walking distance. I don't know how close the nearest resaurant is, as we had lunch and dinner while we were touring Montreal, but we did enjoy drinks in the bar of the Double Tree across the street. The staff of Chateau L'Argoat were friendly and helpful. We think this hotel is a real bargain and have recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel, Enjoyable Stay.”
Reviews.Author: FSU-Jenny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our 3 day stay at this hotel in late August 2008. The hotel is outside Vieux Montreal, but the Sherbrooke metro station is just a 2 minute walk up the street, which makes getting around the city convenient. The staff at the front desk were very friendly, provided us with good directions, and were very knowledgeable about the metro system and buses to Quebec City. There is a free continental breakfast (bagels, muffins, croissants, juice, and coffee), which is served by a waitress in a little breakfast room. The sesame bagels were quite good. Our room had a queen bed and a standard bathroom (I think it was room 12). The bed was a bit hard, but the bathroom was very large, bright, and airy with a big bathtub. The room faced the back of the hotel, so it was pretty quiet. Be sure to notice all the cool abstract artwork throughout the hotel. The hotel does not have an elevator, which could present a problem for some people. Overall, we were very happy with the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsClaus
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews of this hotel in TripAdvisor and it was recommended in their Montreal Trip Guide. I was not disappointed. We had a large corner room (Room 26) which had a very large bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and the maid service was good. The only caveat is that there was no glass (real or plastic) in the room, so be sure to ask for one. We asked for one the first night but forgot to ask for one the second and the maid took our glass from the night before. The continental breakfast which is included is just that: a choice of croissant, muffin or bagel, juice and tea or coffee. It was fresh and the muffins were huge. The hotel is located a little bit away from the main part of town but right across the street from the metro station. The best part is that the hotel provides FREE parking behind the hotel and this is a great benefit as many of the hotels either don't provide parking or charge a pretty penny for it. The desk clerks were very helpful and courteous. There are no elevators so if you have trouble climbing stairs be sure to ask for a room on the first floor. We got our exercise going up and down two flights of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Really cool hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rubella14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in for 13 days spanning June/July of this year for our honeymoon and really loved it. We booked a small room, and in retrospect, we should have gotten a larger one for such a lengthy stay, but it was adequate and very cute. The hotel staff was very pleasant. The breakfast was excellent every day (I could have taken dozens of the chocolate pastry home with me!). The parking was tight, as others have mentioned, but the desk staff always happily moved cars around and it wasn't really an issue since we were across the street from a metro stop anyway. The hotel is located nearby to some great and vegetarian friendly restaurants. My husband and I are really laid back and low maintenence, so this low frills place was cool for us, and a great value. On our budget, it was a great alternative to some soul-less chain.

Reviews.Title: “We Would Do it Again!”
Reviews.Author: Want2travelallaround
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a lovely trip to Montreal and Quebec City. We have traveled a lot but this was the first time that we didn't choose a chain hotel listed in AAA. This boutique hotel was perfect. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was clean, extremely quiet and had very interesting decorations. The bathroom however, was very small (room17). Parking was included as long as you were willing to leave your key and they had no problem letting us keep the car there for an extra 2 hours on day of checkout. The location was ideal; the metro is about a block away (actually had a choice of 2 stations) and within easy walking distance to restaurants (St. Denis Street). We were even able to walk to Old Montreal. We had bought a Montreal Pass for $50 which allowed unlimited use of the Metro or bus, and entrance to most of the museums if used within 3 consecutive days. We loved the metro; easy to get around, clean, frequent trains and it seemed safe. The hotel served a limited continental breakfast (served to you, not buffet) but adequate. Although the menu is in French, most items can be figured out or the waitress does speak English. There are an unbelievable number of restaurants nearby, of course a lot of French ones and they were all good. Our favorite restaurant, however was a Spanish one called Pintxo off of St. Denis. (The pork chops were great.) We definitely would recommend this hotel and would stay here again. We did not miss the amenities of a big chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Chateau L'Argoat”
Reviews.Author: hasherdoug
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel experience. We stayed for nights in July 2008. The front desk staff was always very friendly and helpful. Free breakfast was tasty and it was a nice touch having it served. The first room we were in was a bit on the small side, however when the airconditoning failed we were immediatley moved to another room which was quite a bit bigger. Both rooms very comfortable with interesting colour schemes. The location is fantastic very close to all of the sights. A short walk to Rue St Denis for many restaurant and shopping choices. I cannot recommend this hotel enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Benzie82
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and were very impressed with the size and the cleanliness of the room for the price, the bathroom looked as though it was recently renovated with a large tub and updated fixtures. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly with directions and we were really happy with the free wireless internet and parking, although with the close proximity of the metro our rental car stayed in one spot for the duration of our stay. The one big issue we found was the state of the bed and bedding. The mattress was extremely hard which made for a difficult good night's sleep, the bedding itself also looked a little threadbare and in need of replacement. Overall I would say that our stay was very nice, but would probably stay some place else on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: david88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chateau de l'Argoat for four nights last month, and I can't begin to describe the value of this hotel. I'll try, though. Upon arrival, we met the ever nice and over helpful Gregore, who directed us to our room - which turned out to be a big room, a smaller one and separate bathroom and toilet rooms. Everything was spotlessly clean. The hotel location is, as said before, right across the street from the metro station, though we discovered that for five people it's actually not more expensive to take a big taxi... The breakfast was simple, but very tasty, and the staff was the friendliest staff i've ever seen, anywhere. Gregore, Gilles, the girl from Quebec city whose name I forgot and everyone else, they were all there whenever we needed something, no matter what, always with a smile and great will to help. We never met the hotel owner, but I would like to congratulate her for picking such a good staff. For summary: unless you're looking for a large, chain-type hotel, you could not be wrong by choosing the Chateau de l'Argoat. We will definitely stay there again, if and when we're in Montral

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Angie37
Reviews.Content: We satyed at the Chateau for 5 nights and it was a great experince. The staff was excelent, always in a very good mood and the service was just perfect. The hotel felt like home. The room (number 26) was very quiet and roomy. The bathroom was very big and there was space for everything. The only problem was the bed, not very comfortable. The location was perfect, just 2 blocks from St. Denis where there are lots of good restaurants and one block from the metro station.
